deleted_text: The corridor hums. Air filtration, steady and low. I press my spine to the wall and count my breaths—four in, four out—while my fingertips trace the seam where two panels meet. Cold. Riveted. The kind

The corridor hums. Air filtration, steady and low. I press my spine to the wall and count my breaths—four in, four out—while my fingertips trace the seam where two panels meet. Cold. Riveted. The kind
